channel.title: Signed Vs. Unsigned
channel.description:
as i slowly progress along the path of bot-making, i have come to the realisation that i will have to choose between signed or unsigned
i will attempt to list some pros and cons for each, and would love your input
Signed + faster to load - have to learn about the loader (ohnoes!!!) - i havent ever looked at the loader - profiles for accounts for data downloaded (prevent detectability (a paranoid safe measure)) - disk space for data
Unsigned + noob friendlier :D + no loader + easier to check *stuff* - slow to load

item.title: Signed Vs. Unsigned
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you go with unsigned and write a good SecurityManager you will never have to worry about half the things they could do with a signed client, like check running processes, scan files (like cookies) on your harddrive, check which IRC networks you are on etc etc. And unsigned is not ‘suspicious’ at all like bAsh said, because thousands and thousands of people have no other way to run it, they provide the unsigned client for this very reason, so you might as well use it to your advantage.

Read full topic

item.title: Signed Vs. Unsigned
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“ruler, post:6, topic:124111”]nexus has a boolean one can set to use signed / unsigned (designed to change)[/quote]Great! Who cares?

Read full topic

item.title: Signed Vs. Unsigned
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

If you’re going to the effort of making a bot, you’d might as well learn about the loader, and then just go along with signed. It’s worth it in the long run.

Read full topic

item.title: Signed Vs. Unsigned
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“Fasga, post:5, topic:124111”]When the signed option only has one pro, yet the unsigned option has 3, I would say the choice is quite obvious.[/quote]that is because it is all i could think of, i was wishing for other people’s input

Read full topic

item.title: Signed Vs. Unsigned
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“BAsh(CntLgn), post:3, topic:124111”]Yes because they can’t access the UID. If they had any sense though they would use a cookie.
On the other hand they very fact that you use an unsigned client is suspicious.[/quote]

I’m pretty sure a large portion of the RS population uses unsigned. My lil bro had to use unsigned because normal wouldn’t work on a Limited XP account.

Read full topic

item.title: Signed Vs. Unsigned
item.dc:creator: @BAsh_CntLgn BAsh(CntLgn)
item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

shangtsung1:

Unsigned less detectable?

Yes because they can’t access the UID. If they had any sense though they would use a cookie.
On the other hand they very fact that you use an unsigned client is suspicious.

Read full topic

item.description:

as i slowly progress along the path of bot-making, i have come to the realisation that i will have to choose between signed or unsigned

i will attempt to list some pros and cons for each, and would love your input

Signed

  • have to learn about the loader (ohnoes!!!)
  • i havent ever looked at the loader
